thread.title: Trump Inaugural TV Rating Off From Obama â€™09: Hollywood Reporter
thread.title_full: Trump Inaugural TV Rating Off From Obama â€™09: Hollywood Reporter

title: Trump Inaugural TV Rating Off From Obama â€™09: Hollywood Reporter
text:
The TV audience for President Donald Trump’s inauguration fell from that of Barack Obama eight years ago, according to preliminary ratings data cited by the Hollywood Reporter. 
Initial audience data show Trump’s swearing-in produced a household rating of 27.7, or almost 28 percent of the 116.4 million U.S. television households, the trade publication reported, without saying where it got the information. Obama’s preliminary rating eight years ago, when he took office as the nation’s first African-American president, was 37.2, according to the report. 
Obama’s initial numbers ultimately translated into a national audience of 37.8 million, the second-largest since 1969, according to Nielsen data going back to Richard Nixon’s first inauguration. Ronald Reagan’s first inauguration in 1981 holds the audience record at 41.8 million viewers. 
The preliminary data are based on programming from the seven networks that ran live inaugural coverage for much of the day, the Hollywood Reporter said. 
Among networks, Fox News led with its coverage and was the only network to increase its audience from eight years ago. NBC finished No. 2 and led among broadcast networks, the publication said. 
Individual networks may release their audience numbers later on Saturday. Nielsen may also report a total audience number for U.S. cable and broadcast networks. Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
